usage.description: Backstory Engine-Conflict pairs create character origin stories with present-day plot hooks
usage.placement: Tuck diagonally under the Agent or Anchor they originate from, pointing at the Agent or Anchor they orient toward
integration: Keep expansion cards separate - Draw Backstory Engines and Backstory Conflicts instead of standard ones when exploring origin stories
Mix Backstory Engines into main deck, keep Backstory Conflicts separate - When you draw a Backstory Engine, replace the paired Conflict with a Backstory Conflict
notes: Can be used in simple prompts as long as both Engine and Conflict are from the backstory expansion
Can have both a standard Engine-Conflict pair AND a Backstory Engine-Conflict pair connecting two cards, giving them both a backstory and a present-day relationship
